page.title: 14FAMILY LIFE 11
page.content: Our lunch on Sunday is usually a roast joint which is eaten around 1.00p.m. This can be either beef,pork or lamb roasted in the oven with potatoes which have been peeled and put in the oven with the meat to cook for between 1 and 2 hours. We also have 1 or 2 other vegetables. The pudding is generally something a little special, perhaps lemon meringue pie-pastry base covered with lemon filling and a fluffy meringue on top-or cheesecake-biscuit base covered with sweet yoghurt or cream filling. In the afternoon we do some administration work and have sandwiches and cake for tea at about 5.30p.m.The children then do there musical practices and go to bed as during the week. The routine of our life does not vary much excepr on special occasions.
